Host agrees not to incorporate the recording of the Speech into any other paid product without the express, written consent of the Speaker.

Publicity Release - Speaker irrevocably permits Host to use Speaker’s name, image, likeness, appearance, voice, and professional and personal biographical information to promote the Speech.
Clause Help:
This clause sets out what the parties are agreeing to about the ownership of the speech.

In the first substantive paragraph, the Speaker specifically assures the host that the material does not infringe anyone else's copyrights. A "representation and warranty" is just legalese for assurances.

The next two paragraphs set out who owns the speech and the recording. The Speaker owns the speech itself, while the Host is given the right to livestream and record the speech. Notably, although the Host owns the recording, the Host agrees not to include it in any other paid products without getting permission from the Speaker.

The final paragraph gives the Host permission to use the Speaker's name, image, and likeness to promote the event.
Delete Warning: You should not delete this clause. This clause sets out a careful balance of who owns the speech and the recording of the speech. If you remove this clause, it will be unclear who may do what with the speech and the recording.

Clause Text:
Intellectual Property & Use Restrictions

If Your Guest Post is selected for publication:

  • You agree not to submit Your Guest Post for consideration or publication anywhere else and agree not to republish the Guest Post on Your own blog, Medium, or any similar channel. You are free to quote from and promote the Guest Post on Your social media channels, but You may not republish it in its entirety. 
     
  • If Your Guest Post is accepted for publication, you agree to assign and do hereby assign all rights, title, and interest in the Guest Post to the Company. This shall include the copyright in the Guest Post, including rights to paternity, integrity, disclosure, withdrawal, and any other rights that may be known as “moral rights” in the Guest Post.
     
  • You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless the Company, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, successors and assigns from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, actions, judgments, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind arising out of or resulting from any breach of Your representation and warranty that You are the sole owner of the Guest Post and that publication of the Guest Post by the Company will not infringe any copyrights held by others. 
     
  • You irrevocably permit the Company to use Your name, image, likeness, appearance, professional and personal biographical information, and all materials created by or on behalf of the Company that incorporate any of the foregoing in perpetuity in so far as it is used to advertise, market, or promote the Guest Post of the Blog.
Clause Help: This clause addresses ownership of the guest blog post. Specifically, it transfers ownership to you, makes clear that the author may not submit it elsewhere, requires the author to defend you against any copyright infringement claims, and allows you to use the author's name, image, and likeness to promote the post.
Delete Warning: Do not remove this clause. For content, it is critical to include a clause that addresses things like copyright ownership. If you remove this clause, the author will own the post and will have the right to submit it elsewhere (or publish it themselves).

Clause Text:
Intellectual Property & Use Restrictions

If Your Guest Post is selected for publication:

  • You agree not to submit Your Guest Post for consideration or publication anywhere else and agree not to republish the Guest Post on Your own blog, Medium, or any similar channel. You are free to quote from and promote the Guest Post on Your social media channels, but You may not republish it in its entirety. 
     
  • If Your Guest Post is accepted for publication, You agree to grant and hereby do grant to the Company an exclusive, irrevocable, worldwide, unlimited, royalty-free license to use, publish, reproduce, display, distribute copies of, and prepare derivative works based upon the Guest Post.
     
  • You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless the Company, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, successors and assigns from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, actions, judgments, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind arising out of or resulting from any breach of Your representation and warranty that You are the sole owner of the Guest Post and that publication of the Guest Post by the Company will not infringe any copyrights held by others. 
     
  • You irrevocably permit the Company to use Your name, image, likeness, appearance, professional and personal biographical information, and all materials created by or on behalf of the Company that incorporate any of the foregoing in perpetuity in so far as it is used to advertise, market, or promote the Guest Post of the Blog.
Clause Help: This clause addresses ownership of the guest blog post. Specifically, it says the author continues to own it but gives you the exclusive right to publish it. It goes on to makes clear that the author may not submit it elsewhere, requires the author to defend you against any copyright infringement claims, and allows you to use the author's name, image, and likeness to promote the post.
Delete Warning: Do not remove this clause. For content, it is critical to include a clause that addresses things like copyright issues. Without this clause, you do not have a right to publish the work, and the author will have the right to submit it elsewhere (or publish it themselves).

Clause Text:
Intellectual Property Rights

The Parties agree as follows:

Speaker’s Representations And Warranties - Speaker represents and warrants that the content of the Speech, all material to be displayed or distributed during the Speech, and any other material provided by Speaker are the original work of Speaker or are works for which the Speaker has obtained the necessary permission to display and distribute. Speaker further represents and warrants that the use of these materials during the Speech will not infringe on any third party’s rights. Specifically, Speaker represents and warrants that these materials do not infringe upon any third party’s copyrights.

Ownership of Content - Speaker is the sole owner of all rights, title, and interest in the Speech and all other materials provided by the Speaker. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as an assignment of any such rights.

Right to Livestream and Record - Speaker agrees that Host may stream the Speech over the internet in real time, record the Speech, and distribute copies of any such recording. Speaker grants to the Host, its affiliates, successors, and assigns a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, unrestricted, royalty-free license to the content of the Speech for such purposes. The Parties agree that Host shall be the sole owner of any such recording. For the avoidance of doubt, Speaker agrees that Host may include a recording of the Speech in other products, including other paid products.

Publicity Release - Speaker irrevocably permits Host to use Speaker’s name, image, likeness, appearance, voice, and professional and personal biographical information to promote the Speech.
Clause Help:
This clause sets out what the parties are agreeing to about the ownership of the speech.

In the first substantive paragraph, the Speaker specifically assures the host that the material does not infringe anyone else's copyrights. A "representation and warranty" is just legalese for assurances.

The next two paragraphs set out who owns the speech and the recording. The Speaker owns the speech itself, while the Host is given the right to livestream and record the speech. Notably, although the Host owns the recording, the Host agrees not to include it in any other paid products without getting permission from the Speaker.

The final paragraph gives the Host permission to use the Speaker's name, image, and likeness to promote the event.
